content: 00mm/g6 hook and 30 chain stitches in orange and 1 change stitch in yellow return to using 3 25 mm/ usd3 hook attached to the next yellow stitch 31 stitches from where you started chain stitches technically this should be 30 chains but i find adding a chain makes the next row easier this stitch will also be made in the v of the previous row 6 single_crochet in yellow since you are making the opening you cannot catch the previous yellow yarn under a few orange stitches it will just hide in the pokeball after the zipper is added ending text highlight as the color changes are easier now 42 round 12 4 single_crochet in yellow single_crochet in yellow but insert the hook into the lower v of the yellow stitch in the previous row 30 orange single_crochet in the bottom bumps of the chain stitches like you did before catch the yellow yarn under the first ~3 of the orange stitches later you can cut this yarn near where its hiding under the stitches and use a tapestry needle to weave in the end securing the otherside which is the other leg of the v near the opening single_crochet in yellow but insert the hook into the lower v of the yellow stitch in the previous row 6 single_crochet in yellow 42 round 13-14 4 single_crochet in yellow single_crochet in yellow but insert the hook into the lower v of the yellow stitch in the previous row 30 orange stitches single_crochet in yellow but insert the hook into the lower v of the yellow stitch in the previous row 6 single_crochet in yellow 42 round 15 4 single_crochet in yellow single_crochet in yellow but insert the hook into the lower v of the yellow stitch in the previous row decrease in orange 3 single_crochet in orange decrease in orange x 5 4 single_crochet in orange single_crochet in yellow and insert the hook into the lower v of the yellow stitch in the previous row this will be one stitch to the right and were you normally would put the v but special note here because you went one more over in orange so make sure you do not add a stitch here when continuing 5 single_crochet in yellow 36 round 16 4 single_crochet in yellow skip a stitch and single_crochet in yellow but insert the hook into the lower v of the yellow stitch in the previous row skipped one stitch to the left because you are decreasing the yellow but you want these v to connect with each other single_crochet in orange in the same v hole if this orange stitch overlaps you can use your hook to make the yellow stitches be showing too make sure you have 10 yellow stitches 27 single_crochet in orange single_crochet in yellow but insert the hook into the lower v of the yellow stitch in the previous row this should be one stitch to the left as you are decreasing
